Quiz 1:
```{r}
# USE TO CALCULATE NORMAL DISTRIBUTION
?dnorm
dnorm(7.47, 3.6, 3.4)
```

```{r}
# USE TO CALCULATE P(X < SPCIFIC VALUE)
# P(x = 2.19) = 0
pnorm(-0.47, 2, 3)
pnorm(10.2,2,3) - pnorm(4.34,2,3)
pnorm(1.28, 2,3,lower.tail = FALSE)
```

```{r}
# USE TO CALCULATE A VALUE SUCH THAT P(X < A VALUE) = SOME PROBABILITY
qnorm(0.88,9.8,2.9)
qnorm(0.47,9.8,2.9,lower.tail = FALSE)
```

```{r}
# USE TO CALCULATE POISSON DISTRIBUTION
?dpois
dpois(3,7.7)
ppois(3,7.7) - ppois(1,7.7) + dpois(1,7.7)
ppois(5,7.7,lower.tail = FALSE)
```

```{r}
# set seed 
set.seed(61554)

# create some data
some_data = rexp(n = 1000, rate = 2.5)

mean(some_data)
median(some_data)
var(some_data)
sd(some_data)
```
```{r}
# load packages
library("mlbench")
library("tibble")

# set seed 
set.seed(33824)

# create some data, coerce to tibble
some_data = as_tibble(mlbench.2dnormals(n = 500, cl = 3))
sum(some_data$classes == 1)
a = which(some_data$classes == 1)
length(a)
b = some_data$x.1
sd(b)
c = some_data$x.2
mean(c > 2)
```
```{r}
# set seed 
set.seed(69200)

# create x and y data vectors
x = rnorm(n = 500, mean = 5, sd = 2)
y = rnorm(n = 500, mean = 4, sd = 2)

sqrt(sum((x-y)^2)/500)
sum(abs(x-y)/500)
```
```{r}
prior = c(0.55, 0.37, 0.08)
0.37 * dpois(x = 5, lambda = 6.27) + 0.55 * dpois(x = 5, lambda = 2.3) + 0.08 * dpois(x = 5, lambda =  8.84)
```
```{r}
# set seed 
set.seed(99315)

# generate data from known poisson distribution
pois_data = rpois(n = 250, lambda = 3.5)

# check data
head(pois_data, n = 10)
?rpois
```
